title: Mathematics of Life Contingencies I
description: Probabilistic introduction to the mathematics of life contingencies.
Theoretical basis for modeling the future lifetime of certain financial objects with an emphasis on insurance.

title: The Mathematical Theory of Interest
description: Amortization of loans, bonds, sinking funds and depreciation.

title: Financial Economics
description: A quantitative introduction to financial economics.

title: Real Analysis l
description: Axioms for, and properties of, the real numbers; sequences;

Intended for Honours students in Mathematics.

title: Computational Mathematics
description: Modelling (discrete and continuous, deterministic and stochastic)
Practical solutions to general categories of applied problems.
Case studies of solutions through modelling and representation of data.

title: Intermediate Microeconomic Theory II
description: Applies the analytical tools from previous courses to analyze resource allocation in imperfectly competitive markets
Factor pricing in alternative market structures.
Considers basic concepts of general equilibrium and welfare economics.
